alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 1:27AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTY THROUGH 200 AM CDT... At 127 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Columbus, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Baxter Springs, Columbus, Galena, Lowell, Treece, Neutral, Melrose, Hallowell, Sherwin, Riverton, Faulkner and Crestline. This includes Interstate 44 near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
